resources.string: -Status update message now reflects actual status\n-Rearrangements in status update section
-Changes to map center and zoom levels to give a nice 3D view on load\n-Removed location permission which was added earlier for future work
-Fixed NULL pointer exception causing FC on no internet connection\n-Added Help section\n-Added in-app Change log
-Fixed Map not loading issue caused due to usage of wrong API key (Earlier, I used API V1 key instead of V2)

-Totally rewrote the app using GMM V2 dumping V1 used in earlier versions\n-Popups of marker info are now attached to the marker\n-Update frequency to 1500ms instead of the available maximum speed in earlier releases
-Auto refresh at maximum possible speed\n-Migrated to latest SDK version

TumTumTracker, shortly TTT, is a project still in the development stages. On successful completion it will be able to help you track TumTum using either the Web or Android application and also a board displayed each bus stop

-Writing NULL to offline markers backup when opened without internet connection, causing 'Loading for first time' dialog on next use (even if its not the first time)

Please bear with the issues. I'm hoping to fix all of these, soon before the project goes live.
Time stamp, accurate to seconds, of the last successful hit of markers info fetching from web server
Time stamp, accurate to seconds, of the last successful update of that particular TumTum\'s location to web server
Currently, the app re-fetches markers info from the web server, 1500 ms after the last hit/fail fetch request. You may see an option to set this refresh time manually in the subsequent versions.

I have put in a lot of time to build this app and keep everything clear to the end-user. If you find something is erroneous or missing. Please bring it to my notice. Send in your suggestions, comments and constructive criticism to praveendath92@gmail.com\n\n
